text: Jealousy, that dragon which slays love under the pretence of keeping it alive.
author: Havelock Ellis

text: Religion can make it worse. Are you supposing that if people were encouraged to believe in a transcendent reality, and to be encouraged by grand rituals and music and preaching, to love their neighbors, then they would put jealousy and frustration aside?
author: Mary Douglas

text: As iron is eaten away by rust, so the envious are consumed by their own passion.
author: Antisthenes

text: Jealousy contains more of self-love than of love.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

text: The envious die not once, but as oft as the envied win applause.
author: Baltasar Gracian

text: Jealousy is love bed of burning snarl.
author: George Meredith

text: There tends to be a jealousy in England towards countries that are successful.
author: Chris O'Dowd

text: Jealousy is the tie that binds, and binds, and binds.
author: Helen Rowland

text: On the same line of reasoning, if Australians were to be Australians, or rather if Australians were as separate from any other nation as Australia from any other land, there would be no jealousy between them on England's account.
author: Henry Lawson

text: I like jealous men. I love jealousy. I do.
author: Adriana Lima

text: But I like not these great success of yours for I know how jealous are the gods.
author: Herodotus

text: I don't get jealousy, I don't get how people hate each other - I never did.
author: Nas

text: People are taken aback by a confident, pretty girl who knows what she wants in life and isn't going to let anyone get in her way. And you know what it's all about? Jealousy.
author: Summer Altice

text: Jealousy - that jumble of secret worship and ostensible aversion.
author: Emile M. Cioran

text: You will not accept credit that is due to another, or harbor jealousy of an explorer who is more fortunate.
author: Abbott L. Lowell

text: To jealousy, nothing is more frightful than laughter.
author: Francoise Sagan

text: You can be the moon and still be jealous of the stars.
author: Gary Allan

text: There is never jealousy where there is not strong regard.
author: Washington Irving

text: Like hatred, jealousy is forbidden by the laws of life because it is essentially destructive.
author: Alexis Carrel

text: He that is jealous is not in love.
author: Saint Augustine

text: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything. Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

text: I don't watch that much comedy. I think it's professional jealousy. That and a lack of support for my community.
author: Michael Ian Black

text: A negative judgment gives you more satisfaction than praise, provided it smacks of jealousy.
author: Jean Baudrillard

text: Jealousy is the grave of affection.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

text: More men die of jealousy than of cancer.
author: Joseph P. Kennedy

text: That is ever the way. Tis all jealousy to the bride and good wishes to the corpse.
author: J. M. Barrie

text: Guard with jealous attention the public liberty. Suspect everyone who approaches that jewel. Unfortunately, nothing will preserve it but downright force. Whenever you give up that force, you are inevitably ruined.
author: Patrick Henry

text: My birth neither shook the German Empire nor caused much of an upheaval in the home. It pleased mother, caused father a certain amount of pride and my elder brother the usual fraternal jealousy of a hitherto only son.
author: Conrad Veidt

text: Life is one big road with lots of signs. So when you riding through the ruts, don't complicate your mind. Flee from hate, mischief and jealousy. Don't bury your thoughts, put your vision to reality. Wake Up and Live!
author: Bob Marley

text: I think it's important to get your surroundings as well as yourself into a positive state - meaning surround yourself with positive people, not the kind who are negative and jealous of everything you do.
author: Heidi Klum

text: The jealous are troublesome to others, but a torment to themselves.
author: William Penn

text: The jealous are possessed by a mad devil and a dull spirit at the same time.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

text: Man is jealous because of his amour propre woman is jealous because of her lack of it.
author: Germaine Greer

text: Moral indignation is jealousy with a halo.
author: H. G. Wells

text: The surest route to breeding jealousy is to compare. Since jealousy comes from feeling less than another, comparisons only fan the fires.
author: Dorothy Corkville Briggs

text: Jealousy lives upon doubts. It becomes madness or ceases entirely as soon as we pass from doubt to certainty.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

text: Jealousy would be far less torturous if we understood that love is a passion entirely unrelated to our merits.
author: Paul Eldridge

text: The knives of jealousy are honed on details.
author: Ruth Rendell

text: Lovers may be - and indeed generally are - enemies, but they never can be friends, because there must always be a spice of jealousy and a something of Self in all their speculations.
author: Lord Byron

text: Nature is at work. Character and destiny are her handiwork. She gives us love and hate, jealousy and reverence. All that is ours is the power to choose which impulse we shall follow.
author: David Seabury

text: Jealousy is the tribute mediocrity pays to genius.
author: Fulton J. Sheen

text: Jealous, adj. Unduly concerned about the preservation of that which can be lost only if not worth keeping.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.
author: Salvador Dali

text: I have experienced jealousy, possessiveness, verbal abuse and violence from men, but I have also experienced jealousy, possessiveness, verbal abuse and violence from women, usually when I failed to respond to their advances.
author: Julie Burchill

text: Jealousy is a dog's bark which attracts thieves.
author: Karl Kraus

text: Jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire.
author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol

text: My wife's jealousy is getting ridiculous. The other day she looked at my calendar and wanted to know who May was.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

text: Love shouldn't be about jealousy or anything like that. It should be about commitment and being able to trust that person. If you can't have that from the get-go, there's a problem.
author: Aaron Carter

text: What makes the pain we feel from shame and jealousy so cutting is that vanity can give us no assistance in bearing them.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

text: Jealousy is the jaundice of the soul.
author: John Dryden

text: That's one of the reasons I moved to Florida. Of course, the main reason is the weather and the training. But there's more jealousy in Switzerland because it's so little and they don't have so many athletes.
author: Martina Hingis

text: That's the way I got along in life. I don't ever remember being particularly jealous of anybody, because I figured if I can't do it myself, I don't deserve to get it.
author: Clyde Tombaugh

text: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.
author: George Orwell

text: The jealousy and resentment that animate the terrorists also affect many of our former cold war allies.
author: Richard Perle

text: People can do all kinds of things that maybe aren't wise in hindsight because of jealousy.
author: Kristin Bauer van Straten

text: The lovesick, the betrayed, and the jealous all smell alike.
author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

text: Jealousy is never satisfied with anything short of an omniscience that would detect the subtlest fold of the heart.
author: George Eliot

text: I do not say anything from jealousy.
author: Anna Held

text: From heresy, frenzy and jealousy, good Lord deliver me.
author: Ludovico Ariosto

text: I am drawn to women who are independent and creative, which is problematic because it's a struggle, a competition of careers. There's jealousy.
author: Marilyn Manson

text: Jealousy is, I think, the worst of all faults because it makes a victim of both parties.
author: Gene Tierney

text: Passion can quickly slip to jealousy, or even hatred.
author: Arthur Golden

text: When I see a good singer, I get teary-eyed. Part of it is jealousy because all comedians are frustrated rock stars. That's a fact.
author: Jeff Ross

text: Never underestimate the power of jealousy and the power of envy to destroy. Never underestimate that.
author: Oliver Stone

text: But when I would see the surrogate, my first instinct, my first reaction would be jealousy, because she was doing what I wanted to do.
author: Cheryl Tiegs

text: Don't waste time on jealousy. Sometimes you're ahead, sometimes you're behind.
author: Mary Schmich

text: I do a lot of sexy publicity, but I have yet to have any bad experiences regarding jealousy.
author: Brooke Burke

text: Obviously, in dealing with a relationship, sexuality has to be involved, and jealousy and emotions like that. And I don't know, I've always been intrigued by those emotions.
author: Adrian Lyne

text: What we used to say was whoever had the bow tie got to lead the band. There was never any jealousy.
author: Pete Fountain

text: Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent.
author: Milan Kundera

text: It is remarkable that jealousy of individual property in land often goes along with very exaggerated doctrines of tribal or national property in land.
author: William Graham Sumner

text: No jealousy their dawn of love overcast, nor blasted were their wedded days with strife each season looked delightful as it past, to the fond husband and the faithful wife.
author: James Beattie

text: Lovers may be and indeed generally are enemies, but they never can be friends, because there must always be a spice of jealousy and a something of Self in all their speculations.
author: George Byron

text: Magnanimous people have no vanity, they have no jealousy, and they feed on the true and the solid wherever they find it. And, what is more, they find it everywhere.
author: Van Wyck Brooks

text: Those who are believed to be most abject and humble are usually most ambitious and envious.
author: Baruch Spinoza

text: It will be found an unjust and unwise jealousy to deprive a man of his natural liberty upon the supposition he may abuse it.
author: George Washington

text: Jealousy is not at all low, but it catches us humbled and bowed down, at first sight.
author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

text: Jealousy... is a mental cancer.
author: B. C. Forbes

text: That is ever the way. 'Tis all jealousy to the bride and good wishes to the corpse.
author: James M. Barrie

text: I would rather drudge out my life on a cotton plantation, till the grave opened to give me rest, than to live with an unprincipled master and a jealous mistress.
author: Harriet Ann Jacobs

text: There is a sort of jealousy which needs very little fire it is hardly a passion, but a blight bred in the cloudy, damp despondency of uneasy egoism.
author: George Eliot

text: Jealousy is all the fun you think they had.
author: Erica Jong

text: It is not love that is blind, but jealousy.
author: Lawrence Durrell

text: There is something mean in human nature that prefers to think evil, that gives a willing ear and a ready welcome to calumny, a sort of jealousy of goodness and greatness and things of good report.
author: Richard Le Gallienne
